channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 2024 Real Estate Investing Strategy Showdown: Rentals, Flips, & New Builds
item.description: House flipping vs. renting vs. build-to-rent: which real estate investing strategies could make you the MOST money in the second half of 2024? At the beginning of the year, many […]

item.title: Bangladeshi police agents accused of selling citizens’ personal information on Telegram
item.description: Two senior police officials in Bangladesh are accused of collecting and selling citizens' personal information to criminals on Telegram. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: As Murders Increased, St. Louis Police Struggled for Resources to Solve Cases
item.description: The city’s homicide unit has dealt with short staffing, long hours and a ballooning DNA backlog.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: How to Use BiggerPockets to Grow Your Brand and Network
item.description: BiggerPockets has become synonymous with real estate investing. You can learn about just about any topic under the umbrella of real estate if you’re willing to explore. There are bootcamps, […]

item.title: Carta’s valuation will be cut by billions in an upcoming secondary sale
item.description: Carta, a once-high-flying Silicon Valley startup that loudly backed away from one of its businesses earlier this year, is working on a secondary sale that would value the company at $2 billion, TechCrunch has learned. Carta is working with the investment bank Jeffries on the sale and initially hoped to find demand for the offering […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Some St. Louis Detectives May Have Botched Homicide Investigations
item.description: Several officers in the homicide unit faced internal complaints that they slept on the job, failed to get key evidence and lied to superiors.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: A Deep Dive Into Home Insurance and the Stark Realities Facing Investors
item.description: On a calm Mother’s Day, my family and I left our snug bed and breakfast, only to come back to a pretty disheartening sight. The roof rack of our trusty […]

item.title: Boeing’s Starliner overcomes leaks and engine trouble to dock with ‘the big city in the sky’
item.description: Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft has successfully delivered two astronauts to the International Space Station, a key milestone in the aerospace giant’s quest to certify the capsule for regular crewed missions. Starliner safely docked at 10:34 AM Pacific Time. After taking some time to equalize pressure between Starliner and the station, the hatch opened at around 12:46 […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Jury of Trump’s Peers Weighs In
item.description: We asked 12 people with criminal convictions what they think of the verdict in Trump’s hush money trial.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: Mortgage Porting: The Latest Way for Investors to Beat High Interest Rates?
item.description: Mortgage porting allows you to transfer an existing mortgage from one property to another, with the same lender and the same terms, under certain conditions. Is this something investors should try?

item.title: Rivian’s path to survival is now remarkably clear
item.description: Rivian needs to sell its new revamped vehicles at a profit in order to sustain itself long enough to get to the cheaper mass market R2 SUV on the road. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: In St. Louis, a Racial Disparity in Whose Killings Get Solved
item.description: In the past decade, police solved fewer than half of the homicide cases with Black victims and two-thirds of the cases with White ones.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: The Disaster That Is Canadian Real Estate—and Lessons From It
item.description: Interest rates have increased in Canada as well, but with more negative consequences.

item.title: What to expect from WWDC 2024: iOS 18, macOS 15 and so much AI
item.description: Apple is hoping to make WWDC 2024 memorable as it finally spells out its generative AI plans. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How We Reported on Homicide Investigations in St. Louis
item.description: Getting and interpreting homicide clearance data involved litigation, complex analysis and patience.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
